@vahidhashemian Thanks. The main addition here is the error checking in `fetchLogEndOffset`. We're actually not sure what caused the trace that Dustin provided on the JIRA, but it seems pretty clear that we were missing the error check, so we're hoping to get more info with this patch. And yeah, I couldn't help myself adding a couple minor refactors (mainly I was trying to eliminate some of the uses of `TopicAndPartition`).

This is a follow up to #2837 
After introducing new exception `BrokerNotFoundException` we missed to update the corresponding system test.

Call for review @enothereska @dguy @guozhangwang
System test passed: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/272/

This is a duplicate of https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2701

By the way, since the additional `System.nanoTime` call per selection key only happens if the new config is enabled, I think it's OK to merge this and do additional performance testing later. I think this is one of the cases where issues only show themselves when the number of threads and CPUs is larger than one can test on a laptop.
Wrong user name, closing PR.

**In more details:**

Although 'jackson-annotations' releases patch versions regularly, those patches are not aligned with all other jackson dependencies. 
Kafka example (how 'jackson-annotation' version resolves for other jackson artifacts):
 * **'com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider'** version _**2.8.5**_ -->> transitive dependency **'com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations'** version resolves to **_2.8.5_** 
 * **'com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind'** version **_2.8.5_** -->> transitive dependency **'com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations'** version resolves to _**2.8.0**_
 
 I won't get into more jackson related details (separate issue will be filed on jackson-annotation github repository).

On Kafka side: two submodules resolve 'jackson-annotations' version to 2.8.0, while one of them resolves to 2.8.5:

```
dejans@DEV-DS MINGW64 /c/Work/IDEA-17/other/kafka (trunk)
$ ./gradlew -q :tools:dependencyInsight --configuration runtime --dependency jackson-annotations
Building project 'core' with Scala version 2.10.6
com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.8.0
\--- com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:2.8.5
     \--- runtime
```

```
dejans@DEV-DS MINGW64 /c/Work/IDEA-17/other/kafka (trunk)
$ ./gradlew -q :connect:json:dependencyInsight --configuration runtime --dependency jackson-annotations
Building project 'core' with Scala version 2.10.6
com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.8.0
\--- com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:2.8.5
     \--- runtime
```

```
dejans@DEV-DS MINGW64 /c/Work/IDEA-17/other/kafka (trunk)
$ ./gradlew -q :connect:runtime:dependencyInsight --configuration runtime --dependency jackson-annotations
Building project 'core' with Scala version 2.10.6
com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.8.5 (conflict resolution)
\--- com.fasterxml.jackson.module:jackson-module-jaxb-annotations:2.8.5
     \--- com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider:2.8.5
          \--- runtime

com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.8.0 -> 2.8.5
\--- com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:2.8.5
     +--- project :tools
     |    \--- runtime
     +--- com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider:2.8.5
     |    \--- runtime
     +--- com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-base:2.8.5
     |    \--- com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider:2.8.5 (*)
     \--- com.fasterxml.jackson.module:jackson-module-jaxb-annotations:2.8.5
          \--- com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider:2.8.5 (*)

(*) - dependencies omitted (listed previously)

dejans@DEV-DS MINGW64 /c/Work/IDEA-17/other/kafka (trunk)
$ git lg -1
* b15422177 - (HEAD -> trunk, origin/trunk, origin/HEAD) MINOR: ProducerPerformance should work with older client jars (83 minutes ago)<Jun Rao>

dejans@DEV-DS MINGW64 /c/Work/IDEA-17/other/kafka (trunk)
$ date
23 Apr 2017 18:52:47

dejans@DEV-DS MINGW64 /c/Work/IDEA-17/other/kafka (trunk)
```


Gradle goal _**releaseTarGz**_ simply creates kafka distribution out of kafka submodules artifacts plus their runtime dependecies; hence, **_kafka distribution ends up with two 'jackson-annotations' jars_**:


![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19467899/25315916/8bac039c-285d-11e7-8014-45e4f47d14c8.png)

Options to solve this:
1. do nothing and wait for Jackson crew to allign dependencies on their side
2. force version for 'jackson-annotations' only
3. use gradle resolution strategy failOnVersionConflict (for all configurations); it means that 'jackson-annotations' version must be forced along with few more dependencies:
```
    configurations.all {
        resolutionStrategy {
            failOnVersionConflict()
            force "org.slf4j:slf4j-log4j12:$versions.slf4j"
            force "org.slf4j:slf4j-api:$versions.slf4j"
            force "org.apache.zookeeper:zookeeper:$versions.zookeeper"
            force "log4j:log4j:$versions.log4j"
            force "com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:$versions.jackson"
            force "org.javassist:javassist:3.21.0-GA"
            force "junit:junit:$versions.junit"
            force "org.objenesis:objenesis:2.2"
            force "org.bouncycastle:bcprov-jdk15on:$versions.bcpkix"
            force "commons-collections:commons-collections:3.2.2"

        }
    }	 
```
4. **_I opted for this one:_** use gradle resolution strategy failOnVersionConflict (for provided configuration **_only_**): 
```
    configurations {
        runtime {
            resolutionStrategy {
                failOnVersionConflict()
                force "org.slf4j:slf4j-log4j12:$versions.slf4j"
                force "org.slf4j:slf4j-api:$versions.slf4j"
                force "org.apache.zookeeper:zookeeper:$versions.zookeeper"
                force "log4j:log4j:$versions.log4j"
                force "com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:$versions.jackson"
                force "org.javassist:javassist:$versions.javassist"
            }
        }
    }
```
Closed in favor of #2900.
Thanks for the PR. Why do we need to force the other dependencies?

Not sure why builds are failing:
* I tried to execute ***./gradlew test*** prior to PR creation, but I received checkstyle errors for java classes (obviously, I haven't changed any of them)
* Jenkins builds for Scala 2.11/2.12 both failed while executing this task *:core:copyDependantLibs*, however, that task works for me locally (could be that I'm missing some extra parameter used by Jenkins builds... will try to find out looking at Jenkins builds).

On a brighter side: Scala 2.10 checks are green :)
Ok, I just found out this resource: https://github.com/apache/kafka#running-a-task-on-a-particular-version-of-scala-either-2106-or-2118 .... Back to drawing board, will sort this out asap.
